identificationModule.briefTitle: Endovascular Thrombectomy Alone Versus Intravenous Thrombolysis Plus Thrombectomy on Acute Basilar Artery Occlusion
identificationModule.officialTitle: Endovascular Thrombectomy Alone Versus Intravenous Thrombolysis Plus Endovascular Thrombectomy on Acute Basilar Artery Occlusion - a Multicenter, Randomized Controlled, Clinical Trial

leadSponsor.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of University of Science and Technology of China

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To assess the effect of endovascular thrombectomy alone compared to intravenous thrombolysis plus endovascular thrombectomy in acute basilar artery occlusion patients within 4.5 hours from onset on efficacy and safety outcomes.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Two recent randomized, controlled trials from China-ATTENTION (Trial of Endovascular Treatment of Acute Basilar-Artery Occlusion) and BAOCHE (Trial of Thrombectomy 6 to 24 Hours after Stroke Due to Basilar-Artery Occlusion) have shown a significantly beneficial effect of endovascular thrombectomy in patients with an acute symptomatic basilar artery occlusion. The DEVT (Direct Endovascular Treatment versus Standard Bridging Therapy for Acute Stroke Patients with Large Vessel Occlusion in The Anterior Circulation) and DIRECT-MT (Direct Intraarterial Thrombectomy in Order to Revascularize Acute Ischemic Stroke Patients with Large Vessel Occlusion Efficiently in Chinese Tertiary Hospitals Trial) trials showed that endovascular thrombectomy alone is not inferior to intravenous alteplase bridging with endovascular treatment in terms of achieving 90-day functional independence for stroke patients with large vessel occlusion. However, it is unclear whether endovascular thrombectomy alone is noninferior to intravenous thrombolysis bridging with endovascular thrombectomy for achieving functional independence at 90 days among patients with acute basilar artery occlusion. Therefore, additional studies are needed to explore the potential benefit of endovascular thrombectomy alone in these patients.

conditions: Stroke Due to Basilar Artery Occlusion

armGroups.label: Endovascular thrombectomy alone
armGroups.description: Patients will receive endovascular thrombectomy without intravenous thrombolysis.

armGroups.label: Intravenous thrombolysis plus endovascular thrombectomy
armGroups.description: Patients will receive intravenous alteplase (0.9mg/kg, maximum 90mg) or tenecteplase (0.25mg/kg, maximum 25mg) before endovascular thrombectomy.

interventions.name: Intravenous thrombolysis
interventions.description: Patients will receive intravenous alteplase (0.9mg/kg, maximum 90mg) or tenecteplase (0.25mg/kg, maximum 25mg) before endovascular thrombectomy.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0-2 at day 90 (±14 days)
primaryOutcomes.description: The modified Rankin Score is an ordinal hierarchical scale ranging from 0 to 6, with higher scores indicating more severe disability.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0-3 at day 90 (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The modified Rankin Score is an ordinal hierarchical scale ranging from 0 to 6, with higher scores indicating more severe disability.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0-1 at day 90 (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The modified Rankin Score is an ordinal hierarchical scale ranging from 0 to 6, with higher scores indicating more severe disability.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0-4 at day 90 (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The modified Rankin Score is an ordinal hierarchical scale ranging from 0 to 6, with higher scores indicating more severe disability.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ordinal Shift analysis of modified Rankin Score at day 90 (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The modified Rankin Score is an ordinal hierarchical scale ranging from 0 to 6, with higher scores indicating more severe disability.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Score on the National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) at 24 hours
secondaryOutcomes.description: The NIHSS is an ordinal hierarchical scale to evaluate the severity of stroke by assessing a patient's performance. Scores range from 0 to 42, with higher scores indicating a more severe deficit.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Score on the NIHSS at 5-7 days or discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: The NIHSS is an ordinal hierarchical scale to evaluate the severity of stroke by assessing a patient's performance. Scores range from 0 to 42, with higher scores indicating a more severe deficit.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Score on the EuroQoL 5-dimensions 5-level (EQ5D-5L) at 90 days (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a questionnaire designed to assess five dimensions of life quality related to mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain or discomfort, and anxiety or depression (range: 0.39 to 1, with a higher score indicating a higher quality of living)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: level of activities of daily living (Barthel index, BI) at 90 days (±14 days)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Barthel Index is an ordinal scale for measuring performance of patients'self-care activities of daily living. Scores range from 0 to 100, with 0 indicating severe disability and 95 or 100 indicating no disability that interferes with daily activities.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Successful reperfusion (Extended thrombolysis in cerebral infarction [eTICI] score 2b50-3) on digital substraction angiography (DSA) prior to thrombectomy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Evaluate effect of intravenous thrombolysis on reperfusion

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Successful reperfusion on final angiography of thrombectomy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Evaluate effect of thrombectomy on reperfusion
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 5 minutes at final angiography of thrombectomy

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Successful recanalization on CT or MR angiography within 72 hours
Infarct volume (Posterior Circulation Acute Stroke Prognosis Early Computed Tomography Score, PC-ASPECTS) evaluated on CT or MRI within 72 hours
secondaryOutcomes.description: PC-ASPECTS=10 indicates a normal scan, PC-ASPECTS=0 indicates early ischemic changes or hypoattenuation in all above territories. 1 or 2 points each are subtracted for early ischemic changes or hypoattenuation in: left or right thalamus, cerebellum or posterior cerebral artery territory, respectively (1 point); any part of midbrain or pons (2 points)

otherOutcomes.description: Symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage defined as local or remote parenchymal hemorrhage type 2, subarachnoid hemorrhage, or intraventricular hemorrhage that led to death or was observed on an imaging scan obtained 24 to 72 hours after treatment, combined with a neurologic worsening of at least 4 points from baseline on the NIHSS or from the lowest NIHSS score between baseline and 24 hours, or death from any cause within 90 days.

otherOutcomes.measure: Overall mortality at 7 (± 2 days) and 90 (± 14 days)
